main event: Multiple unidentified flashing red lights were observed and tracked on radar by control tower personnel at Lincoln AFB, Nebraska, on 13 February 1957.
interesting points: The objects' altitude was estimated to be below 6,000 feet., The sighting lasted for about 30 minutes., Control tower personnel observed the lights using both the naked eye and binoculars., The lights displayed erratic movement, appearing to be both stationary and moving at extreme speeds., One of the objects was described as round or rotating with a brightness similar to an automobile headlight.
witness description: control tower personnel including air traffic control specialists
